result.execSummary:
The defendant Zelner Bonds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Straight time. With release to the Day Reporting Center.  No electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all MANDATORY costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
Court waived NON-MANDATORY cost due to financial instability.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Cognitive intervention programming.
COURT DOES NOT SUSPEND DRIVING PRIVILEGES.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zelner Bonds

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

 Statements made as to sentencing.
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served;Straight time.  With release to the Day Reporting Center.  No electronic monitoring.   COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Defendant to pay all MANDATORY costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

**COURT DOES NOT SUSPEND DRIVING PRIVILEGES.

Court waived NON-MANDATORY cost due to financial instability

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is participating in counseling.  Defendant is having trouble maintaining sobriety.  State motions the court for revocation of the agreement.  Court take motion under advisement.  Review hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Outreach Community Health Centers, received and filed.  lms

Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is going through ADOA thearpy. Defendant informed the court that his last test was negative, documentation pending.   With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is attending treatment at Outreach.  Defendant is having issues maintaining sobriety.  State is willing to extend the agreement to allow the defendant to produce negative UAs.  With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is attending treatment, however the defendant continues to test positive.  State needs to see negative test or State will revoke.  Court request results of all the test.  With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is testing positive.  Matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has completed 30 hours of community service.  Defendant has not been drug tested.  Defendant needs to begin AODA treatment.  Review hearing scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has an appointment with Outreach Community Health Center.  Defendant needs to begin community service.  Review hearing scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.   Court approves the agreement.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and STAYS a judgment of conviction.  Review hearing scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant needs to determine which treatment program will be covered by his insurance.  Defense moves for an adjournment.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant qualifies for the drug court, but needs to obtain a monitoring agency.  Defense moves for an adjournment.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case may be resolved with a possible Deferred Prosecution Agreement. Defense to obtain a monitoring agency.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Zelner Bonds in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Zelner Bonds in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
